metadata.title: CVE-2023-30456 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in arch/x86/kvm/vmx/nested.c in the Linux kernelbefore 6.2.8. nVMX on x86_64 lacks consistency checks for CR0 and CR4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-212-generic - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-212-generic - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-212-lowlatency - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1120-kvm - 4.4.0-1120.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1157-aws - 4.4.0-1157.172
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-aws - 4.15.0-1157.170~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-gcp - 4.15.0-1151.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1120-oracle - 4.15.0-1120.131~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1120.130').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1157.172').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.170~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.167~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1120.131~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
